description:
In this course, students will learn how to model mathematically the
measurements as well as the challenges of noise and incompleteness.
Students will cover a set of techniques, broadly known as "regularization"
methods, which utilize so-called constraints to improve the condition of
the inverse problem and arrive at solutions that are closer to the true
source than the level of noise and incompleteness might have led one to
expect. The course will investigate on the so-called "sparsity-based" or
"compressive" regularizers, which during the last decade emerged as very
powerful for several applications (notably, medical imaging,) despite being
computationally rather complex.
title: Introduction to Imaging Science
